summary: Turns out the hooded ice dude isn't either of the Todorokis. What Horikoshi actually intended to do is show us Dabi's reaction...
body: Turns out the hooded ice dude isn’t either of the Todorokis. What Horikoshi actually intended to do is show us Dabi’s reaction on Ice Quirk. We wanted to give us a hint of Dabi’s connection to it.

reblog.comment: Turns out the hooded ice dude isn’t either of the Todorokis. What Horikoshi actually intended to do is show us Dabi’s reaction on Ice Quirk. We wanted to give us a hint of Dabi’s connection to it.

blog.name: chickenparm
blog.title: Varied Fanfics.
blog.description:
Requests are always open for one-shots.
My Hero Academia Master List

title: Mean It(G, One-Shot, Midoriya/GenderNeutral!Reader)
body:
Inspired by this prompt by @speech-prompts.

Requests are always open for MHA dudes/reader one-shots. Lay ‘em on me fam.

“Thanks for your help, Midoriya.”

Your friendship was passed the point of him becoming embarrassed at your mere words. It was your arms wrapping around his shoulders for a long moment that caused the green-haired boy to burst into stammering and trembling.

“I-It was nothing, r-really! Math is one of my best subjects, s-so it’s no um… It’s not a problem, I-I swear!”

When you pulled away, his face was flushed, and his eyes were pointed everywhere in your dorm room but you. Midoriya had a habit of fidgeting his hands together when he was nervous, like he wasn’t sure what to do with them. It had been months since you’d seen him this flustered by something you had done to him, and you couldn’t help the laugh that bubbled out of you.

“Well, I appreciate it, seriously. You should probably head back before Aizawa-sensei comes around for curfew checks.”

“Right! O-Okay, I’ll see you tomorrow!” Midoriya promised and a long moment of hesitation, a small smile on his lips as he offered a wave to you before ducking out of your dorm. The door shut silently behind him, and you let out a long breath into the remaining silence.

You were a liar. You had no problems in Math, especially the easy unit that you were learning, but… It had become a bit harder to interject on Midoriya’s time lately, and his time was something you were sorely addicted to. As you gathered your paperwork on your study desk and filed it away, you couldn’t stop yourself from plotting your next move to steal a bit more of his attention.

It seemed a bit pathetic, using underhanded tactics just to spend time with one of your friends, but you were desperate. Being in his presence was one of your favorite feelings, and every moment you could steal to soak up his warmth was one that you wouldn’t pass up. You had fallen for him, that much was obvious to yourself despite successfully hiding that fact from every other person.

With your belongings put away, you changed into something more suited to sleeping and flipped your light off. Tomorrow was Friday, and Aizawa had hinted at a bit of strenuous training tomorrow for the Hero portion of the day, so sleeping was in your best interest.

You felt like a huge creep, but Midoriya had been sitting on your bed explaining the material that you already knew and had leaned against your pillows in an effort to get comfortable. You told him to do so, with the hidden agenda of his scent rubbing off on them. Pulling one to your chest, you buried your nose into the top and inhaled.

It was faint, but it was there, and your heart raced. If he knew what you were doing, you’d be labelled a creep, but it was the only thing you could do just to snag a piece of him for a small moment. You pined after him heavily, the thought of his bright smile and freckled cheeks and shining personality…

You weren’t sure how long it was that you held the pillow, but Aizawa had already done the curfew checks and it was well into the night when a quiet knock echoed through the door, almost imperceptible. You sat up, tucking the pillow back into the pile and smoothing it out before swinging your legs off the bed.

The doors didn’t have peep-holes, so you swung it open with only a moment of hesitation to see your late-night visitor.

Your heart caught, but you stomped it down and kept your expression as one of curiosity, “…Midoriya? Did you forget something?”

“I-I… Um… Can I just… Come in? Please?”

“Oh… Uh… Yeah, of course, always,” You stepped to the side and he took small, slow steps passed you. The hard line of his hunched shoulders told you that he was nervous, but one look at his fidgeting hands was even more telling. With the door shut behind the two of you, you turned the lock and rounded on him.

You normally left the curtains open, being on the third floor and all, so the moonlight coming in illuminated him from the back and cast him in an ethereal light, one that made your heart squeeze tightly. It took your breath away seeing him like this, in a situation that was new to both of you.

“Is something wrong?” You broke the silence—Regretfully, of course—and Midoriya flinched a bit at your words before finally lifting his head and showing you the expression on his face. His cheeks were flushed, but your attention was pulled more to the watery gaze he was giving you. After a moment, you realized that his flush was not only coming from embarrassment, but from the fact that he had obviously been crying about something.

Midoriya didn’t answer your question, but he let his eyes drop to the floor again. You took a step forward to try and pull him into an embrace, but he took an equal step backward with a stumble. His hand reached out behind him to steady himself on your nightstand, and he looked at you once more with a mixture of emotions. Sadness, desperation, guilt.

“Midoriya…” You started again, but he shook his head and clenched his eyes shut. This only served to cause his previously unshed tears to fall down his cheeks, and the sight of it broke your heart. In this moment, you didn’t bother to hide your feelings, and knew you looked several shades of worried.

“I-I… I just… C-Can I…” Midoriya stopped himself, taking a long breath that shook in his chest before exhaling, “I’m sorry, I-I can’t… I keep thinking about it and I can’t take it any longer. I feel like… I-I feel like I’m going to burst if I don’t do something.”

“I’m not following, Midoriya. Did someone hurt you?” You took another step forward, but his flinch made you freeze in your steps. Definitely, someone had hurt him. He wouldn’t be acting this way with you otherwise, right?

Midoriya’s breaths shook, mirrored by his trembling shoulders, and he snapped his eyes up to you with all of those emotions written over his face, “Please, tell me you love me. I know you won’t mean it, but please… Just once, and then I’ll go away.”

Your breath left your body in one go, leaving you hollow as you tried to grasp at the meaning of his words. He… Wanted you to say something like that? There’s no way he would want that unless he felt that way about you. Midoriya, despite his face practically glowing red, stared you down with desperation in his eyes.

How long had he been thinking about this? He must have really reached the final straw if he was crying in your dorm well after midnight. Just the sight of him looking so broken up over this was almost enough to make you cry. Instead, you forced a breath into your lungs so you could answer him.

“How do you know whether I mean it or not?”

Midoriya let out a confused noise, before bowing his head, “I-I know—… I know you don’t feel that way. A-At least not about me, not about someone like… Someone like me.”

“What are you talking about? Someone like you?”

“A… nobody.”

“I don’t see a nobody,” You reached out to him, finally close enough to touch, and curled your hand under his chin to lift it and allow you to look in his eyes, “I see a somebody. A somebody that I love, too.”

“I-I don’t… Are you only saying that because I… Because I asked?”

“No, I’m saying it because I feel it,” You promised, and his expression started to change as your words dawned on him. Inside you were screaming, that you must be dreaming about Midoriya confessing to you in your room, but the lurch of his body as he yanked you to his chest was completely real.

reblog.comment:
Inspired by this prompt by @speech-prompts.

Requests are always open for MHA dudes/reader one-shots. Lay ‘em on me fam.

“Thanks for your help, Midoriya.”

Your friendship was passed the point of him becoming embarrassed at your mere words. It was your arms wrapping around his shoulders for a long moment that caused the green-haired boy to burst into stammering and trembling.

“I-It was nothing, r-really! Math is one of my best subjects, s-so it’s no um… It’s not a problem, I-I swear!”

When you pulled away, his face was flushed, and his eyes were pointed everywhere in your dorm room but you. Midoriya had a habit of fidgeting his hands together when he was nervous, like he wasn’t sure what to do with them. It had been months since you’d seen him this flustered by something you had done to him, and you couldn’t help the laugh that bubbled out of you.

“Well, I appreciate it, seriously. You should probably head back before Aizawa-sensei comes around for curfew checks.”

“Right! O-Okay, I’ll see you tomorrow!” Midoriya promised and a long moment of hesitation, a small smile on his lips as he offered a wave to you before ducking out of your dorm. The door shut silently behind him, and you let out a long breath into the remaining silence.

You were a liar. You had no problems in Math, especially the easy unit that you were learning, but… It had become a bit harder to interject on Midoriya’s time lately, and his time was something you were sorely addicted to. As you gathered your paperwork on your study desk and filed it away, you couldn’t stop yourself from plotting your next move to steal a bit more of his attention.

It seemed a bit pathetic, using underhanded tactics just to spend time with one of your friends, but you were desperate. Being in his presence was one of your favorite feelings, and every moment you could steal to soak up his warmth was one that you wouldn’t pass up. You had fallen for him, that much was obvious to yourself despite successfully hiding that fact from every other person.

With your belongings put away, you changed into something more suited to sleeping and flipped your light off. Tomorrow was Friday, and Aizawa had hinted at a bit of strenuous training tomorrow for the Hero portion of the day, so sleeping was in your best interest.

You felt like a huge creep, but Midoriya had been sitting on your bed explaining the material that you already knew and had leaned against your pillows in an effort to get comfortable. You told him to do so, with the hidden agenda of his scent rubbing off on them. Pulling one to your chest, you buried your nose into the top and inhaled.

It was faint, but it was there, and your heart raced. If he knew what you were doing, you’d be labelled a creep, but it was the only thing you could do just to snag a piece of him for a small moment. You pined after him heavily, the thought of his bright smile and freckled cheeks and shining personality…

“Oh… Uh… Yeah, of course, always,” You stepped to the side and he took small, slow steps passed you. The hard line of his hunched shoulders told you that he was nervous, but one look at his fidgeting hands was even more telling. With the door shut behind the two of you, you turned the lock and rounded on him.

You normally left the curtains open, being on the third floor and all, so the moonlight coming in illuminated him from the back and cast him in an ethereal light, one that made your heart squeeze tightly. It took your breath away seeing him like this, in a situation that was new to both of you.

“Is something wrong?” You broke the silence—Regretfully, of course—and Midoriya flinched a bit at your words before finally lifting his head and showing you the expression on his face. His cheeks were flushed, but your attention was pulled more to the watery gaze he was giving you. After a moment, you realized that his flush was not only coming from embarrassment, but from the fact that he had obviously been crying about something.

Midoriya didn’t answer your question, but he let his eyes drop to the floor again. You took a step forward to try and pull him into an embrace, but he took an equal step backward with a stumble. His hand reached out behind him to steady himself on your nightstand, and he looked at you once more with a mixture of emotions. Sadness, desperation, guilt.

“Midoriya…” You started again, but he shook his head and clenched his eyes shut. This only served to cause his previously unshed tears to fall down his cheeks, and the sight of it broke your heart. In this moment, you didn’t bother to hide your feelings, and knew you looked several shades of worried.

“I-I… I just… C-Can I…” Midoriya stopped himself, taking a long breath that shook in his chest before exhaling, “I’m sorry, I-I can’t… I keep thinking about it and I can’t take it any longer. I feel like… I-I feel like I’m going to burst if I don’t do something.”

“I’m not following, Midoriya. Did someone hurt you?” You took another step forward, but his flinch made you freeze in your steps. Definitely, someone had hurt him. He wouldn’t be acting this way with you otherwise, right?

Midoriya’s breaths shook, mirrored by his trembling shoulders, and he snapped his eyes up to you with all of those emotions written over his face, “Please, tell me you love me. I know you won’t mean it, but please… Just once, and then I’ll go away.”

Your breath left your body in one go, leaving you hollow as you tried to grasp at the meaning of his words. He… Wanted you to say something like that? There’s no way he would want that unless he felt that way about you. Midoriya, despite his face practically glowing red, stared you down with desperation in his eyes.

How long had he been thinking about this? He must have really reached the final straw if he was crying in your dorm well after midnight. Just the sight of him looking so broken up over this was almost enough to make you cry. Instead, you forced a breath into your lungs so you could answer him.

“How do you know whether I mean it or not?”

Midoriya let out a confused noise, before bowing his head, “I-I know—… I know you don’t feel that way. A-At least not about me, not about someone like… Someone like me.”

“What are you talking about? Someone like you?”

“A… nobody.”

“I don’t see a nobody,” You reached out to him, finally close enough to touch, and curled your hand under his chin to lift it and allow you to look in his eyes, “I see a somebody. A somebody that I love, too.”

“I-I don’t… Are you only saying that because I… Because I asked?”

“No, I’m saying it because I feel it,” You promised, and his expression started to change as your words dawned on him. Inside you were screaming, that you must be dreaming about Midoriya confessing to you in your room, but the lurch of his body as he yanked you to his chest was completely real.

summary:
*Class 1-A at the store*
Aizawa: Sir, I've lost my children, could I use your mic to make an announcement?
Store clerk: Of...
body:
*Class 1-A at the store*

Aizawa: Sir, I’ve lost my children, could I use your mic to make an announcement?

Store clerk: Of course

Aizawa: *Over the mic* Goodbye you little shits

summary:
Kaminari: Are you the big spoon or the little spoon?
Bakugou: I'm the knife
Kirishima: He just wraps all four limbs around me...
body:
Kaminari: Are you the big spoon or the little spoon?

Bakugou: I’m the knife

Kirishima: He just wraps all four limbs around me and never let’s go, he’s a koala
